name: Narrator
description: Narrator is a screen reader for Windows that helps make the operating system more accessible for people who are blind and low vision. Narrator reads and interacts with things on the screen, like text and buttons. You can also use Narrator to read and write email, browse the internet, and work with documents. You can use specific commands to navigate Windows, the web, and apps. Navigation is available using headings, links, landmarks, and more. You can read text (including punctuation) by page, paragraph, line, sentence, word, and character, as well as understand text characteristics like font and text color. You can also can adjust the pitch, speed, and volume of the voice.

youTubeVideos.title: Windows 11 Accessibility Tools | Narrator
How to use the Narrator screen reader in Windows 10 | Microsoft

name: VoiceOver
description: VoiceOver is a screen reader that provides spoken descriptions of what's on your Apple device's screen. It can help you use your device, even if you can't see the screen, such as read text in documents and windows, describe what's on your screen, including the battery level, who's calling, or what item your finger is on.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Navigate your iPhone or iPad with VoiceOver | Apple Support
How To Enable Voiceover Screen Narration on macOS [Tutorial]

name: TalkBack
description: TalkBack is a screen reader found on Android devices that helps people who are blind or low vision interact with their device using touch and spoken feedback.  It reads out loud what’s on the screen, like apps, buttons, and text, so you can understand what you are touching or selecting. TalkBack lets you use gestures to move around and do things on your Android device. You can use one finger or multiple fingers, depending on your device. Every device works with one-finger gestures, but updates devices such as the Android R, Pixel 3 and Samsung Galaxy can also use multi-finger gestures.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use TalkBack screen reader
TalkBack - Accessibility on Android

name: NaturalReader
description: NaturalReader can read aloud any type of text, whether it's from a webpage, a PDF document, an image, or even a physical book you take a picture of. It turns text into natural-sounding audio and even lets you create an audio file so you can listen offline. You can choose from different voices and languages, or use the "Voice Cloning" feature to create a personalized AI voice that mimics your own or someone else's voice. You can also control how fast or slow the text is read aloud.

youTubeVideos.title: Text to Speech Online with AI Voices
NaturalReader Mobile App text to speech
NaturalReader Chrome Extension - Listen to Any Online Text

name: Balabolka
description: Balabolka is a Text-to-Speech (TTS) program that reads text aloud using the voices installed on your computer.  It can turn text from various file types like PDFs, Word documents, and eBooks into speech, and even save the audio as a file. Balabolka can read the clipboard content, extract text from documents, customize font and background color, control reading from the system tray or by the global hotkeys.  Balabolka supports text file formats: AZW, AZW3, CHM, DjVu, DOC, DOCX, EML, EPUB, FB2, FB3, HTML, LIT, MD, MOBI, ODP, ODS, ODT, PDB, PRC, PDF, PPT, PPTX, RTF, TCR, WPD, XLS, XLSX.

youTubeVideos.title: Balabolka Demo
How to use Balabolka Text to Speech TTS Software

name: JAWS
description: JAWS is a screen reader for Windows that assists users who are blind or low-vision in using a Windows computer.  It reads out loud the text on the screen, like menus, documents, and websites. You can control JAWS using keyboard shortcuts to move around, select items, or enter text, and it provides spoken feedback or braille output if you're using a braille display. It's customizable, so you can change how fast it speaks, what voices it uses, and even how it describes certain things.

youTubeVideos.title: What is JAWS?
JAWS Windows 10 Desktop Overview
What is JAWS?

name: nvAccess
description: NVDA (Non-Visual Desktop Access) is free screen reader for Windows that helps people who are blind and low vision access and interact with their Windows computers and other computer applications.  It works by reading aloud what's on the screen, like text, buttons, and even web pages. You can navigate your computer using your keyboard or a Braille display. NVDA supports popular programs like web browsers, Microsoft Word, and Excel, and it can even read PDFs and text under the mouse pointer. NVDA is available in over 50 languages.

youTubeVideos.title: NVDA: The free software empowering blind people world wide
What is NVDA?
Screen Reader Basics: NVDA -- A11ycasts #09

name: Kurzweil 3000
description: Kurzweil 3000 is a tool designed to help people of all ages who need help with with reading, writing, or learning.  It reads text out loud from books, PDFs, or websites, helping users follow along with what’s on the screen. The tool also highlights words as it reads, making it easier to track. You can customize the reading speed, use different voices, and even change background colors for better readability. It has word prediction and other features to help with notetaking and organizing ideas. It can also translate words or full passages to over 70 languages.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Use Kurzweil 3000

name: SuperNova
description: Dolphin SuperNova is a tool for blind and low vision users that provides screen magnification, screen reading, and braille support.

youTubeVideos.title: Dolphin SuperNova PC Magnifier And Screen Reader

name: ScreenReader
description: Dolphin ScreenReader is a screen reading software for people who are blind or low vision.

youTubeVideos.title: Dolphin SuperNova PC Magnifier And Screen Reader

name: Publisher
description: Dolphin Publisher is a software that creates talking books using text files and generates human-sounding speech. You can also customize it to your needs by adding visuals, images and navigation.

youTubeVideos.title: Dolphin Easy Publisher

name: GuideConnect
description: With Dolphin GuideConnect, you can compose and read email, capture and scan documents, access books and entertainments, make video calls, and more. The application itself uses large print text with high contrast colors to help those who have low vision or might be losing their sight.

youTubeVideos.title: Dolphin Guide Connect Demonstration

name: EasyConverter Express
description: EasyConverter Express converts Microsoft Word documents into a variety of formats so that they are accessible to people who are blind or low vision.

youTubeVideos.title: EasyConverter Express & EasyReader—A Turn key Solution!

name: EasyReader
description: EasyReader is a reading tool designed to make reading eBooks and digital publications. It provides features like text-to-speech, customizable display settings, and navigation tools to improve the reading experience on various devices.

youTubeVideos.title: EasyConverter Express & EasyReader—A Turn key Solution!

name: Spoken Content
description: Spoken Content is a feature found on iPadOS, iOS, and macOS that allows you to select text and have it read aloud to you. You can hear the entire screen or select a specific section. You can also hear what you type spoken out loud, character by character or word by word.

name: Typing Feedback
description:
With Typing Feedback, your iOS, iPadOS or Mac device can give you feedback as you type as well as speak text corrections and word suggestions. On iOS and iPad devices, you can customize your typing feedback by read aloud by characters, adjusts character feedback speed, have it speak words, spear auto-text, or hold to speak predictions. 

On Mac, you can customize your speak typing feedback by choosing echoing by words, by characters, by selection changes, or by modified keys.

youTubeVideos.title: iOS Typing Feedback

name: Key Repeat, Sticky Keys, and Slow Keys
description: When you are using an external keyboard, you can use these settings to prevent characters being entered multiple times with a single key press. You can also change how long your key is pressed to activate it.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Turn On or Turn Off Sticky Keys on iPhone or iPad (iOS)

name: Hover Typing
description: Hover typing is a function that display words in larger text while you're typing. It appears as a larger, dark, input box with larger text once you start typing with your device. You can adjust the box's position to the top of your screen or around the texting input. You can also adjust the hover typing box's display and color. It helps you see what you're typing in bigger size, or highlight misspelled and autocorrected words.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Use Hover Typing for Clearer Text Input in iOS 18

name: Audio Descriptions
description: If the content on your screen contains audio descriptions, your device will automatically play when this feature is turned on. An audio description is a separate audio track that narrates or describes the visual content of a clip, show, or movie.

name: Magnifier
description: The Magnifier app is already installed on your iPhone or iPad. With the app, you can use your device as a magnifying glass to zoom in on objects near you. You can also use the app make objects, text, or people easier to see by applying a color filter, changing the contrast level, turning on the flashlight, and increasing focus. You can also freeze the frame, or take a picture of something, and use apply any of these features.

name: Dictation (Mac)
description: With Dictation, you can enter text just by speaking, anywhere that you can type it.  You can also use typing and Dictation together—the keyboard stays open during Dictation so you can easily switch between voice and touch to enter text.

youTubeVideos.title: How to enable voice dictation on an Apple Mac
Dictation - How to turn voice to text on Mac, iOS & Apple Watch.

name: Dictation
description: With Dictation, you can enter text just by speaking, anywhere that you can type it.  You can also use typing and Dictation together—the keyboard stays open during Dictation so you can easily switch between voice and touch to enter text.

youTubeVideos.title: Use Dictation in Notes — Apple Support
Using the new Enhanced Dictation on iOS 16 ⭐ iOS 16 Tips

name: One--Handed Keyboard
description: On iPhone and iPad, one-hand keyboard is a feature that helps people who can only use one hand to type. It adjusts the keyboard on the screen, making it smaller and moving it to the left or right side so you can easily reach all the keys with one thumb. This feature can be helpful for users with physical disabilities or anyone temporarily unable to use both hands.

name: Zoom
description: The Zoom feature helps you see things better by making part of or the entire screen bigger. n your screen better n many apps, you can zoom in or out on specific items. When the Zoom feature is turned on, you can zoom in on your sceen by double-tapping with three fingers. For example, you can double-tap or pinch to look closer in Photos or on web pages in Safari. You can also use the Zoom feature to magnify the screen no matter what you're doing. You can magnify the entire screen (Full Screen Zoom) or magnify only part of the screen with a resizable lens (Window Zoom). And, you can use Zoom together with VoiceOver.

name: Text Size
description: You can use accessibility features to change the weight, size, and darkness of text to make it easier to read on your iPhone screen. You can also have iPhone underline text you can tap

name: Reduce Onscreen Motion
description: If you don’t want visual motion on your iPhone screen, you can stop or reduce the movement of some screen elements, such as: Parallax effect of wallpaper, apps, and alerts, Screen transitions, Siri animations, Typing autocompletion, Animated full-screen and bubble effects in the Messages app, & Animated images on the Web and in apps

name: Use Darkmode
description: Dark Mode gives the entire iPhone experience a dark color scheme that’s perfect for low-light environments. With Dark Mode on, you can use your iPhone while, for example, reading in bed, without disturbing the person next to you.

name: Refine the display colors
description: To make it easier to see what’s on your iPhone screen, you can invert and filter colors or make transparent items solid.

name: Live Captions (beta)
description: With Live Captions (beta) on iPhone, you can get a real-time transcription of spoken audio. Use Live Captions to more easily follow the audio in any app, such as FaceTime or Podcasts, and in live conversations around you.

name: Customize subtitles and captions
description: iPhone can provide subtitles, closed captions, and transcriptions so you can follow along more easily with audio and video.

name: Blink the iPhone light for notifications
description: You can set the iPhone indicator light to blink when you receive a notification. Indicator light can be useful if you can’t hear the sounds that announce incoming calls or other alerts, or if you might miss audible alerts in a noisy environment.

name: Sound Recognition
description: Your iPhone can continuously listen for certain sounds—such as a doorbell, siren, or crying baby—and notify you when it recognizes these sounds.

name: Type to Siri
description: You can change how quickly or when Siri responds, use text to make requests to Siri, have Siri audibly share notifications, and announce and end calls.

name: Make Real-Time Text (RTT) calls
description: If you have hearing or speech difficulties, you can communicate by telephone using Teletype (TTY) or real-time text (RTT)—protocols that transmit text as you type and allow the recipient to read the message right away. RTT is a more advanced protocol that transmits audio as you type text.

name: MFi Hearing Devices
description: You can use MFi hearing aids or sound processors with iPhone and adjust their settings. See the Apple Support article Made for iPhone compatible hearing devices for a list of models that work well with iPhone.

name: Live Listen
description: You can stream sound from the microphone on iPhone to your Made for iPhone (MFi) hearing devices or AirPods. Streaming sound can help you hear better in some situations—for example, when having a conversation in a noisy environment.

name: Audio Balance
description: You can use mono audio, adjust left-right stereo balance, and—with supported headphones—amplify soft sounds and adjust certain frequencies to best suit your hearing needs. You can also use data from an audiogram to improve the accuracy and sound quality of your headphones.

name: Live Speech
description: With Live Speech on iPhone, you can type and have your words spoken in person, on Phone and FaceTime calls, and in assistive communication apps using any of dozens of voices, including your Personal Voice. (Available in select languages.)

name: Personal Voice
description: If you’re at risk of speech loss or someone with a speech disability, you can create a personalized voice on iPhone to use with Live Speech. With Personal Voice, you can create a voice that sounds like your own to use to type to speak in FaceTime, Phone, and assistive communication apps. (Available in select languages.)

youTubeVideos.title: Video title unavailable

name: Equatio Mobile
description: Equatio Mobile is a math tool for your phone or tablet that simplifies the process of adding math to your digital work on the move. You can handwrite math problems, snap photos of equations, or even dictate them, and Equatio Mobile will convert them into typed math so you can then edit and use it. It’s particularly useful for individuals who prefer to handwrite math but don’t have access to a touchscreen computer or Chromebook, or anyone who finds it easier to explain their understanding out loud.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use Equatio Mobile

name: Proloquo4Text
description: Proloquo4Text is a learning tool that focuses on text-based communication, allowing users to type their messages and have them spoken aloud by the app. It offers predictive text features to speed up the typing process, as well as a variety of languages and voices you can choose from.

youTubeVideos.title: Getting Started with Proloquo4Text

name: Vehicle Motion Cues
description: Vehicle Motion Cues can help reduce motion sickness when using iPhone or iPad in a moving vehicle. This feature uses sensors built into the device to show dots on user screens that move with the motion of the vehicle to reduce sensory conflict, a common cause of motion sickness. These dots are designed to remain on the sides of the screen to avoid interfering with any content. Vehicle Motion Cues can be turned on manually in Control Center or set to automatically turn on when it senses vehicle motion.

youTubeVideos.title: How To Use Vehicle Motion Cues To Reduce Motion Sickness On iPhone

name: ZoomText
description: ZoomText Magnifier/Reader is a integrated magnification and reading program for low-vision users. Magnifier/Reader enlarges and enhances everything on users' computer screen, echoes their typing and essential program activity, and automatically reads documents, web pages, email.

youTubeVideos.title: ZoomText App Reader

name: Fusion
description: Fusion is the ultimate accessibility tool for schools, agencies, training centers, and businesses where individuals with vision loss are served. Fusion provides the best of both worlds – ZoomText® , with its screen magnification and visual enhancements for screen viewing ease, coupled with the power and speed of JAWS®  for screen reading functionality.

name: OpenBook
description: OpenBook converts printed documents or graphic-based text into an electronic text format on your PC, using high-quality speech and the latest optical character recognition (OCR) technology. OpenBook is innovative software designed to enhance success for people who are blind or have low vision who need access to printed and electronic materials. OpenBook and the PEARL document camera create a complete scanning and reading system for work, home, and school.

youTubeVideos.title: Getting the most out of OpenBook software
PEARL Reading Solution from Freedom Scientific

name: Dragon Professional v16
description: Dragon Professional v16 is software that lets you use your voice to control your computer and create documents. It's incredibly accurate, so you can dictate emails, reports, and even code without typing. This frees your hands and can be a major productivity boost, especially if you have difficulty typing or just want to work more efficiently.

youTubeVideos.title: Dragon Naturally Speaking Tutorial #1 (Professional Individual version 15)

name: Dragon Professional Anywhere
description: Dragon Professional Anywhere is a cloud-based app that lets you create documents, emails, and more using just your voice. It's like having a super-accurate personal assistant who types everything you say, no matter where you are or what device you're using. Plus, it syncs your work across all your devices, so you can seamlessly pick up where you left off, even on the go!

youTubeVideos.title: Introducing Nuance Dragon Professional Anywhere

name: Dragon Legal v16
description: Dragon Legal v16 is a speech recognition software program specifically designed for legal professionals. It is powered by Deep Learning technology, which allows it to achieve up to 99% speech recognition accuracy, even for speakers with accents or in slightly noisy environments.

youTubeVideos.title: Dragon Legal  - Quick setup with Voice Recognition

name: Dragon Anywhere Mobile
description: Dragon Anywhere is a smartphone app that lets you create and edit documents using just your voice. It's like having a super-accurate assistant that types whatever you say, even when you're not at your desk! You can dictate long reports, emails, or even fill out forms, all hands-free and on the go.

youTubeVideos.title: Dragon Anywhere - Professional-grade dictation on your mobile device

name: Dragon Medical One
description: Dragon Medical One is a cloud-based speech recognition software designed specifically for healthcare professionals. It allows clinicians to dictate notes, generate charts, and complete other documentation tasks using their voice, freeing up their time to focus on patient care.

youTubeVideos.title: Nuance - Dragon Medical One - Tutorial

name: AutoHotKey
description: AutoHotkey is a free, open-source scripting language for Windows that allows users to easily create small to complex scripts for all kinds of tasks such as: form fillers, auto-clicking, macros, etc.

youTubeVideos.title: AutoHotkey - Beginners tutorial (All the basic functions)

name: Helperbird
description: Helperbird is an accessibility tool designed to assist individuals with various reading and writing challenges, such as dyslexia, ADHD, low vision, and more. It provides features that can improve comprehension and usability of web content. It aims to make web browsing more inclusive and accessible to all users by providing a wide range of customizable features tailored to individual needs.

youTubeVideos.title: Helperbird - Accessibility, Productivity & Web Features Software - Overview

name: Dotepub
description: Dotepub is a web-based tool that allows users to convert web pages into EPUB or MOBI eBook formats. It’s designed for people who prefer to read online content, such as articles, blog posts, and other text-heavy pages, on e-readers, tablets, or offline.

youTubeVideos.title: How to create an ebook from any web page - tutorial by geoffmobile

name: Magnifier
description: Microsoft Windows Magnifier is an accessibility tool built into Windows that enlarges portions of the screen to make text, images, and other elements easier to see. It’s designed to assist users with low vision or those who need help reading small text on their screens.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Use Windows Magnifier and Keyboard Shortcuts | Windows Accessibility & Ease of Access

name: Point and Speak
description: With the Point and Speak feature, located in the Magnifier app, you can use your finger to point to any text or labels in your environment and have your device read it out loud.

name: Dictation (iPad)
description: With Dictation, you can enter text just by speaking, anywhere that you can type it.  You can dictate text instead of typing it on an Apple external keyboard or touchscreen keyboard.

name: ChromeVox
description: Chrome's built in screen-reader.

youTubeVideos.title: Using ChromeVox on your Chromebook: Fundamentals

name: Be My Eyes
description: Be My Eyes is a free app that connects people who are blind or have low vision with sighted volunteers or company representatives for visual assistance. Using a live video connection, it allows users to get real-time help with tasks such as reading labels, navigating unfamiliar environments, or identifying objects. Volunteers speak 185 languages and are available – for free – 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. The AI assistant Be My AI can generate vivid descriptions of images and scenes and answer user questions about them without connecting to a volunteer.

youTubeVideos.title: Be My Eyes - See the world together

name: Be My Eyes for Windows
description:
Be My Eyes for Windows is a free app that uses AI to help users interpret and describe visual content on their Windows desktop. The app provides detailed descriptions of images, documents, and user screens, including application interfaces and web pages. Users can also chat with the AI to ask follow-up questions of what's being described. Additionally, the app can also help users prepare for video calls by describing how they appear on camera, like if they are centered or checking the lighting conditions. 

Be My Eyes for Windows is currently in Beta testing.

youTubeVideos.title: Be My Eyes - See the world together

name: Capti Voice
description: Capti Voice is a reading and learning tool that helps users interact with digital text in multiple ways. It uses text-to-speech technology to read aloud any content in e-books, documents or web pages. The app also offers customization options for improved readability, and provides other functions like note-taking, highlighting, and translations.

youTubeVideos.title: Video title unavailable
Capti Demo Video
Video title unavailable
Video title unavailable

name: Claro MagX
description: Claro MagX is an digital magnifier app. It offers a wide range of magnification, high contrast, and color viewing options to help reduce user eye strain. Users can read small text in books and newspapers, examine and photograph tiny objects and labels, or view menus in dimly lit restaurants.

name: Equatio
description: Equatio makes it easier to create and input mathematical expressions, formulas, and symbols into digital documents. You can speak, handwrite, or use a picture to input math equations. You can then add these equations to documents, presentations, or online learning platforms.

youTubeVideos.title: Equatio Overview Video

name: Detection Mode
description: Detection Mode, found in the Magnifier app, has five features that can be used to detect people or doors, get image descriptions of your objects in your environment, and to read text or interactive labels around you.

name: TapTapSee
description: TapTapSee is designed to help people who are blind or have low vision identify objects they encounter in their everyday lives by tapping on the screen to take a picture. TapTapSee can photograph two or three-dimensional object at any angle and speak the identification back to the user (Note: Spoken identification requires VoiceOver to be turned on).

youTubeVideos.title: Tap Tap See ~ An App That Identifies Objects

name: Voice Dream Reader
description: Voice Dream Reader uses AI text-to-speech technology to convert various digital and physical text formats into spoken audio. It supports a wide variety of languages and voices, with free and paid options, all functioning offline. This app also allows users to change text size, highlight text, and has a built-in dictionary.

youTubeVideos.title: Voice Dream App
Voice Dream Reader App Features Part One
Voice Dream Reader App Features Part Two

name: Glean
description: Glean is a note-taking tool that allows you to record lectures or meetings, automatically capturing audio and generating transcripts. With Glean, you can highlight key moments during a lecture, add text notes for further context, and even create flashcards for studying. It streamlines the note-taking process, making it easier to stay engaged during class and review material effectively afterwards.

youTubeVideos.title: Revolutionize Your Study Routine with Glean!
An introduction to Glean

name: VDWrite
description: Voice Dream Writer helps improve writing with text-to-speech proofreading, phonetic and meaning-based word search, and an automatic generated outline. It reads text aloud to help users catch mistakes and awkward sentences, while the Word Finder suggests the right words and shows definitions. The active outline allows navigation and reorganization of text. The app also supports customizable text appearance, spellcheck, iCloud sync, and export to other apps, like Microsoft Word.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use Voice Dream Writer

name: Announce Notifications
description: You can have Siri announce notifications and calls from apps like Messages on your iPhone speaker, supported headphones, when using CarPlay, and on MFi hearing devices.

name: Switch Control
description: Switch Control is a tool for anyone with limited mobility. It enables you to interact with iPhone by activating a switch, such as pressing an external adaptive button, performing a head movement, or making a voiced or voiceless sound. Using one or more switches, you can navigate a cursor around the iPhone screen, then open the Scanner menu to choose an available action such as tap, zoom in, zoom out, and more.

name: Voiceitt
description: Voiceitt is an speech recognition technology designed to understand non-standard speech and help people talk to others and use computers. It learns your unique way of speaking and translates it clearly. You can use it to have conversations, control your smart home, dictate, write emails, and even have personalized live captions during video calls.

youTubeVideos.title: Voiceitt for Chrome
Voiceitt Introduction
Voiceitt Demo

name: ClaroRead
description: ClaroRead is a text-to-speech software designed to assist individuals who face challenges with print-based information. The software converts written text into spoken words, helping users understand and engage with written content more effectively. ClaroRead offers various features, such as customizable reading settings and proofreading tools.

youTubeVideos.title: A Guide to ClaroRead

name: Otter.ai
description: Otter.ai is a cloud-based transcription service that uses artificial intelligence to convert spoken words into written text. It’s popular among professionals, students, and organizations for its ability to transcribe meetings, lectures, interviews, and other spoken content accurately and quickly. Otter.ai is available as a web application and a mobile app, making it versatile and accessible across devices.

youTubeVideos.title: How To Use Otter AI To Transcribe Audio - Features and Overview

name: WordQ
description: WordQ is an assistive writing tool designed to help individuals with learning difficulties, such as dyslexia, or those who struggle with writing and spelling. WordQ functions as a text-to-speech and word prediction software that aids users in composing text more accurately and confidently. It integrates seamlessly with other applications, allowing users to receive assistance in real-time as they type.

youTubeVideos.title: WordQ for Chrome™

name: Color Filters
description: Microsoft Windows Color Filters is an accessibility feature that modifies on-screen colors to assist users with color blindness or visual disability. It helps users differentiate between colors, making it easier to view content on the screen and interact with their device. The feature is available on Windows 10 and later versions.

youTubeVideos.title: Microsoft 365 Accessibility Features
Customise your display with Colour filters

name: Sullivan+
description: Sullivan+ is a visual aid app designed to help blind and low vision users by providing information through images captured by a smartphone camera. The app features AI for automatic image analysis, text recognition for reading documents aloud, and face recognition to identify people's age and gender. It also includes tools like image description, color recognition, light brightness detection, and a magnifying glass.

youTubeVideos.title: Sullivan+ | Visual Aid App | Henshaws Knowledge Village

name: Siri Pause Time
description: You can change how quickly or when Siri responds, use text to make requests to Siri, have Siri audibly share notifications, and announce and end calls.

name: TD Talk
description: TD Talk is a text to speech app that helps people to talk just using their fingers. You can express yourself naturally with a selection of voices, and switch between different languages and conversation topics. You can engage actively in conversations with word and phrase prediction, and easy in-sentence editing.

youTubeVideos.title: What's New In TD Talk 2.0

name: TD Snap
description: TD Snap offers different communication solutions for people with communication disabilities. It has a variety of page sets that individuals, professionals, and families can choose from to find the best fit for their needs. Some page sets are made by Tobii Dynavox, while others are created by third parties and can be bought within the app. All TD Snap page sets can be accessed by touch, switch, or keyguard and have clear speech output. They also include helpful tools like search, editing, visual supports, and Google Assistant.

youTubeVideos.title: TD Snap Communication App: 10 Minute Overview

name: Proloquo
description: Helps non-verbal individuals or those with speech impairments communicate using pictures and symbols

youTubeVideos.title: Meet Proloquo and Proloquo Coach - The next generation of AAC

name: Select to speak
description: With the select-to-speak feature, a user can choose specific lines or sections of the screen to be read aloud. This can help people with low vision, reading difficulties, or cognitive disabilities access online content or someone who just wants to listen to text spoken aloud while reading it simultaneously.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use Select-to-Speak on your Chromebook

name: Add alt text
description: Add alt text is a feature that provides descriptions for screen content like images, drawings, and other graphics by adding alternative text ensuring accessibility for screen reader users.

youTubeVideos.title: Alt Text Tutorial : Accessibility in G-Suite , Google, Chrome - Fresh BCSC Tech

name: Screen Magnifier
description: Screen magnifier is a tool that makes it easier for individuals to see text and images on screen in the desired size. It makes reading and interacting with digital content, such as websites or documents easier by allowing users to adjust size of the displayed text or images.

youTubeVideos.title: Making Your Chromebook Easier to See

name: Color Inversion
description: Color inversion is a feature that reverses the colors of the screen and text to provide higher contrast and easier readability. This feature applies to all content on your device, including media. For instance, black text on a white screen will appear as white text on a black screen.

youTubeVideos.title: How to invert colors on a Chromebook

name: Dictation
description: Dictation is an accessibility feature that allows you to type using your voice. You can speak to enter text, as well as punctuation marks, symbols, or emojis by speaking their names.

youTubeVideos.title: Dictation Accessibility Feature for Chromebooks (Speech to Text)

name: Cursor Highlight
description: Make your cursor easy to spot by adding a colored ring around it, or change the color of the cursor.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Use Cursor & Caret Highlights on a Chromebook

name: Reading Mode
description: The reading mode simplifies content by removing non-essential elements. You can personalize your experience by customizing font styles, text size, color themes, line height, and letter spacing to suit your preferences. Additionally, you can adjust the side panel width for better viewing.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use Reading mode in Chrome browser

name: Voice Typing (Dictation)
description: You can enter text anywhere on your PC by speaking using voice typing in Windows 11 or dictation in Windows 10. In Windows 11, voice typing uses online speech recognition, while in Windows 10, dictation uses the built-in speech recognition, so there's no need to download or install anything to use it.

youTubeVideos.title: Introduction to Dictation in Windows 10 | Microsoft
How to use voice typing in Windows #microsoft #shorts #windows #notetaking
How to use Dictation in Windows 11: Speech Recognition and Voice Typing

name: Color Contrast

description: Mouse pointer & touch is an accessibility feature that makes the mouse more visible and easier to use by changing the color and size.

description: Lookout is an app that uses computer vision to assist individuals who are blind or have low vision in understanding their surroundings. name: Voice Access
description:
Voice Access allows users to control their device using spoken commands. With Voice Access, you can use your voice to open apps, navigate through menus, and edit text. Get around your phone: Say things like "go back," "go home," or "open Gmail."
Control the screen: Say "tap next" or "scroll down."
Write and edit text: Say "type hello" or "replace coffee with tea."
