name: Grid 3
description: Grid 3 is an advanced communication software designed to facilitate interaction for individuals with communication challenges. It offers a variety of symbol-based augmentative and alternative communication (AAC) tools that enable users to express themselves effectively. In addition to communication, Grid 3 provides features that allow users to control their environment, such as operating smart home devices, computers, and other accessible technology.

youTubeVideos.title: Introducing Grid 3

name: Braina
description: Braina is an AI-powered voice recognition software that enables users to interact with their computers through voice commands. This tool allows users to dictate text, perform online searches, and automate repetitive tasks, improving productivity and accessibility. With Braina, users can easily manage applications, navigate their systems, and execute commands hands-free, making it an ideal solution for individuals looking to streamline their workflows or those who may have difficulty using traditional input methods.

youTubeVideos.title: Braina: Artificially Intelligent Assistant Software for Windows PC

name: Live Captions
description: Live Captions on Android provides real-time, on-device subtitles for spoken content across apps, including videos, podcasts, and audio messages. This feature enhances accessibility by automatically generating captions without requiring an internet connection. Users can customize the appearance of captions and control playback, making it a versatile tool. Live Captions also works in multiple languages across media content and phone calls.

youTubeVideos.title: Introducing Live Caption on Android

name: Touch and Hold Delay
description: Google Touch and Hold Delay is an accessibility feature that allows users to customize the duration of the delay required for touch interactions on their devices. By adjusting this setting, individuals with motor challenges can reduce the risk of accidental taps or long presses, improving their ability to navigate and interact with their device effectively.

youTubeVideos.title: Touch and Hold Delay - Lesson 18 - Android Accessibility Features Course

name: Switch Access (Android)
description: Google Switch Access is an accessibility feature that enables users to control their devices using a switch or keyboard, rather than relying solely on the touchscreen. This feature is particularly beneficial for individuals who may have difficulty with direct touch interactions due to physical challenges. Switch Access allows users to navigate the device, select items, and perform actions by pressing a switch or key, providing an alternative means of interaction that enhances independence and usability.

youTubeVideos.title: Switch Access for Android

name: Vibration and Haptic Feedback
description: Google Vibration and Haptic Feedback is an accessibility feature that delivers tactile sensations through vibrations in response to notifications, button presses, and interactions on the device. Users can customize vibration patterns for different notifications, improving their awareness of incoming messages or alerts without relying on sound.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Turn On Vibration & Haptics on Android

name: Mono Audio
description: Google Mono Audio is an accessibility feature that combines stereo sound into a single audio channel, making it easier for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing in one ear to hear audio content clearly. This feature ensures that all sound elements, whether from music, videos, or notifications, are delivered equally to both ears, preventing any loss of audio information. Users can enable Mono Audio in their device settings, allowing for a more balanced listening experience and ensuring that important sounds are accessible, regardless of hearing capability in one ear.

youTubeVideos.title: Galaxy S22/S22+/Ultra: How to Set Mono Audio To Connected Audio & Phone Speakers

name: Large Mouse Cursor
description: Google Large Mouse Cursor is an accessibility feature that enlarges the size of the mouse pointer on Android devices, improving visibility for users with low vision. By increasing the cursor size, it becomes easier to locate and track the pointer on the screen, facilitating smoother navigation and interaction with apps and content.

youTubeVideos.title: Android Accessibility Large Mouse Pointer

name: High Contrast Text
description: Google High Contrast Text is an accessibility feature designed to enhance the readability of text on screens. By applying a black outline to white text or adjusting color contrasts, this feature makes the text stand out against its background, reducing visual strain and improving clarity. Users can enable this setting in their device's accessibility options, allowing for a more comfortable reading experience, particularly in challenging lighting conditions or for those with low vision.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Turn On/Off High-contrast text [Android 12]

name: Magnification
description: Google Magnification is an accessibility feature that allows users to zoom in on screen content using simple gestures, such as triple-tapping the display. This functionality is particularly beneficial for individuals with low vision, as it enhances the visibility of text, images, and other on-screen elements. Once activated, users can navigate through their device with ease, adjusting the magnification level as needed to improve clarity and detail.

youTubeVideos.title: How To Use Magnifier On Android Device

name: Grayscale Mode
description: Google Grayscale Mode is an accessibility feature that transforms the screen display to grayscale, eliminating color and providing a simpler visual experience. This mode can be particularly beneficial for individuals who experience light sensitivity, helping to reduce eye strain by minimizing the intensity of colors on the screen.

youTubeVideos.title: How To Enable Grayscale Mode On Android Devices | Black & White Mode

name: Hearing Aid Compatibility (HAC)
description: Google Hearing Aid Compatibility (HAC) is a feature designed to enhance the audio experience for users of specific hearing aids. This compatibility ensures that users can receive clearer and more direct audio during phone calls by reducing background noise and improving sound quality. HAC allows for a seamless connection between the device and the hearing aids, facilitating better communication and overall usability for individuals who use hearing aids.

youTubeVideos.title: Hearing aid support on Android

name: Real-time Text (RTT)
description: Google Real-time Text (RTT) is a communication feature that enables users to send and receive text messages simultaneously during phone calls. This functionality is particularly beneficial for individuals who are deaf, hard of hearing, or have speech difficulties, as it allows for a more accessible and effective way to communicate in real-time.

youTubeVideos.title: How To Use RTT

name: Color Correction
description: Google Color Correction is an accessibility feature that modifies the screen's color display to assist users with color blindness. This tool allows individuals to adjust color settings according to their specific color vision needs, making content easier to perceive and interact with. By providing options to customize the display based on different types of color deficiencies, Color Correction enhances the overall user experience and ensures that color-coded information is more accessible to everyone, promoting inclusivity and usability.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Enable Colour Correction on Android

name: TalkBack Braille Keyboradd
description: The TalkBack Braille Keyboard is an on-screen keyboard for Android that allows people with low vision to type using braille directly on their device. The keyboard uses a uses a six-key layout, where each key represents one of the six dots of the braille cell. It supports braille grade 1 and 2 and multiple languages.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use the TalkBack braille keyboard | Android accessibility features

name: Reader by ElevenLabs
description: Reader by ElevenLabs is an application converting text into natural sounding speech for any articles, texts, pdf, and more.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Use Elevenlabs Reader App Free | Tutorial

name: Human Reader
description: Human Reader is a chrome extension that converts any form of text into speech, allowing users to customize the voice generator.

youTubeVideos.title: Human Reader, powered by ElevenLabs - Chrome extension Demo

name: Project Activate
description: Project Activate is a communication app that allows people who are unable to speak or use technology with their hands. Users can send a text message, place a call, speak a phrase, or play an audio file when they make gestures.

youTubeVideos.title: Android Accessibility | Communicate using facial gestures and preset actions

name: Look to Speak
description: Look to Speak is an app designed to assist users with limited mobility or speech challenges. By using the device's front-facing camera, the app can detect eye gaze gestures, allowing users to select pre-written phrases or images and have them spoken aloud.

youTubeVideos.title: Getting started with Look to Speak

name: Virginia Helps the Disabled
description: The Virginia helps the disabled app is a communicator app that can help people who have difficulty using language to communicate.

name: Nagish
description: An AI-powered application that converts text-to-speech and speech-to-text in real time, so that one side of a phone call can type and read, while the other side can hear and speak, aimed to assist those with hearing loss

youTubeVideos.title: Nagish: The startup that uses AI to convert phone calls into text for people with hearing loss

name: Ava
description: Ava is an application that uses live captions and transcriptions for any situation

youTubeVideos.title: Getting Started with Ava Captions

name: Android Reading Mode
description: Reading mode is designed to improve screen reading for people with low vision, blindness, and dyslexia by allowing customization of contrast, text size, text-to-speech, page clutter, and font types.

youTubeVideos.title: Reading mode: A more accessible screen reading experience on Android

name: Auto click (dwell timing)
description: Auto click, also known as dwell timing, is an accessibility feature that automatically clicks a mouse when the cursor stops moving for a set amount of time. This feature can be helpful for people who have difficulty or find clicking uncomfortable.

youTubeVideos.title: Galaxy S22/S22+/Ultra: How to Turn On/Off Auto Click After Pointer Stops

name: One-Handed Mode
description: One-handed mode is a feature that enables more efficient navigation of your device using just one hand. When it's activated, you can use a single hand to pull down the top half of your screen, making it easier to access notifications, app content, and more.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use Android 12's one-handed mode

name: Flash Notifications
description: Flash notifications will alert you of an incoming call, an alarm, or any other notification. You can choose to be notified by camera flash, screen flash, or both. Camera flash isn't available on all devices.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Enable Flash Notifications on Android 14 - Screen & Flashlight Notifications

name: Morse Code
description: Morse code is an accessibility tool that allows users to input text by tapping out dot and dash patterns for each letter. It's part of the Gboard app and can make a real difference for people facing physical challenges. On Android, Morse code works seamlessly with features like Switch Access and TalkBack, so you can use it with assistive technologies.

youTubeVideos.title: Morse code is my voice | Tania’s AI powered story

name: High contrast themes
description: High-contrast themes in Windows help users who are blind or have low vision by increasing the contrast between text, images, and backgrounds, making them easier to read. It also allows users to customize the colors of various screen elements to suit their accessibility needs, such as adjusting specific colors for people with color blindness.

youTubeVideos.title: How To Turn Off High Contrast Mode On Windows 11 [Tutorial]
High Contrast Theme in Windows 10 | APTeck Tutorials

name: Display and vision
description: Windows offers customizable Display and Vision settings, allowing users to personalize cursor size, text size, and colors. The settings are designed to enhance screen visibility for a more comfortable viewing experience. Users can also zoom in on words and images with the Magnifier tool. These features provide greater flexibility and accessibility for users with vision needs.

name: Eye Control
description: Eye Control in Windows 11 allows users to control their PC using eye tracking devices from Tobii and EyeTech. It enables users to navigate, type, and perform mouse actions by simply looking at different parts of the screen. The feature includes a launch pad for quick access to functions like opening Start menu, Text-to-speech, and eye control settings. Eye Control also supports mouse functions and shape writing for screen navigation and text input.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use eye control on a PC running Windows 10 | Microsoft

name: Focus sessions
description: Focus Sessions helps users build healthy digital habits and increase productivity. It activates Do Not Disturb, disables taskbar badges, and integrates with the clock to set a focus timer with break reminders. This feature can help minimize distractions and promote better work habits.

youTubeVideos.title: Focus Sessions in the Windows 11 Clock app

name: Docked magnifier
description: Chromebook's Docked Magnification allows users who are blind or have low vision to zoom in on the top part of the screen while keeping the rest at a normal size. This split-screen effect helps focus on specific content, with the top portion magnified and the bottom unchanged. The feature provides a clearer view of important areas without altering the entire screen. It can be easily enabled or disabled in the accessibility settings.

youTubeVideos.title: How to: an indepth look at the docked magnifier

name: Text to Speech!
description: Text to Speech transforms typed words into audio with 178 voices in 63 languages and accents. Users can adjust the pitch and rate, enable speak as they type, and highlight spoken text for better clarity. The app works offline and allows users to star favorite phrases, organize them into folders, and export audio files. It also supports mixing speech into phone calls and offers personal voice features for iOS 17 and later.

name: Chromebook Keyboard
description: The Chromebook keyboard is a streamlined and optimized keyboard for Chrome OS, featuring unique keys and shortcuts tailored for web-based navigation and productivity. It enhances workflow by integrating intuitive shortcuts that reduce the need for complex key combinations, simplifying tasks like adjusting brightness, volume, or taking screenshots. When paired with Chrome OS's built-in accessibility features, the keyboard supports an inclusive digital environment.

youTubeVideos.title: Chromebooks by Keyboard: Navigating the Chrome OS Interface

name: Safari Reader
description: Safari Reader is an assistive technology feature that strips away ads, buttons, and navigation bars, enabling users to focus on the content. It allows users to adjust the font, font size, and background color. It can also read the text aloud. To enable Reader view for compatible sites, tap Listen to Page in the Page Settings menu or say “Siri, read this.” Users can also use an automatically generated high-level summary and table of contents to help them get the gist of an article.

name: Text-to-Speech Reader
description: The Zabaware Text-to-Speech Reader is a program that employs a voice synthesizer to read documents and other content aloud. It is free to use with generic voices or may be purchased with high-quality CereProc or AT&T Natural Voices at the lowest industry costs.

youTubeVideos.title: How To Text 2 Speech For Free | Zabaware

name: Accomodate
description: Capti Accommodate provides modifications for English Language Learners (ELs) and students with learning or print disabilities, as part of IEP and Section 504 accommodation. The software allows students to listen to online content using high-quality text-to-speech and make visual adjustments. The tool defines English terms, translates words and paragraphs into over 100 languages, and lets you save webpages for later reading on your PC, iPhone, or iPad.

youTubeVideos.title: Video title unavailable

name: KNFB Reader
description: KNFB Reader is a smartphone software that transforms text to voice or Braille for those who struggle with blindness, low-vision, dyslexia, or any other form of difficulty in printing. It can read things like receipts, package labels and mail, nutritional or product information, text on your computer or tablet screen, long documents like books, private documents like tax materials, mortgage documents, bills, and medical reports in more that 30 languages.

youTubeVideos.title: KNFB Reader

name: BrailleBlaster
description: BrailleBlaster uses the extensive markup included in NIMAS (National Instructional Materials Accessibility Standard) files to automate basic formatting and provides tools to help you do complex tasks faster and simpler. BrailleBlaster is primarily intended for editing textbooks that match the criteria given by the Braille Authority of North America, with the goal of assisting braille manufacturers in ensuring that all students get their braille textbooks on the first day of class.

youTubeVideos.title: Introduction to BrailleBlaster (1 of 5)

name: MyStudyBar 4.1
description: MyStudyBar is intended to help with things like organizing, structuring thoughts and ideas, as well as reading and writing. Although this tool was made to help students with literacy problems such as dyslexia, the toolbar has the potential to assist all students. It may help learners organize and arrange their thoughts, employ color overlays to reduce visual stress, listen to digital information read aloud, and enhance typing abilities.

youTubeVideos.title: MyStudyBar (17.06.2021)

name: Conversation Boost
description: Conversation Boost is a feature on AirPods Pro that helps users hear conversations more clearly in noisy environments. It uses the AirPods' microphones to focus on the voice of the person in front of the user, making it easier to follow what they’re saying. This feature is useful for those with mild hearing difficulties or when background noise makes conversations hard to hear. It can be adjusted through iPhone or iPad settings.

youTubeVideos.title: How to turn on Conversation Boost for AirPods Pro on iPhone and iPad | Apple Support

name: DocuScan Plus
description: DocuScan Plus is the most versatile compatible OCR package of its kind. It is the first fully accessible, Internet-based scanning and reading software for the blind and visually challenged that works with both Windows and the Mac. Using a variety of popular scanners or a HoverCam document camera in conjunction with DocuScan Plus, you can convert printed materials and PDF files into text and access your converted documents at a public library, in your office, or on your commute with a mobile device. Connect with one of our helpful customer service representatives to learn more.

youTubeVideos.title: AT Demo - Document Scan Plus

name: Accessibility Keyboard (OSK)
description: The Accessibility Keyboard is an onscreen keyboard that lets you use your Mac without a physical keyboard. It provides advanced typing (such as typing suggestions) and navigation features that you can customize to make it easier to use your favorite apps.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use on screen keyboard on mac

name: Screen Mask
company: David L Smith - not associated to any company
description: Screen Mask is a Chrome extension designed to improve focus and reduce distractions while reading online. By masking out portions of a webpage that aren't currently being read, it helps users concentrate on the text directly in front of them.

youTubeVideos.title: Screen Mask Chrome Extension

name: SpeechTexter
description: SpeechTexter is a multilingual speech-to-text application designed for transcribing notes, documents, reports, and more using voice input. It features a customizable voice commands list, allowing users to add punctuation marks and frequently used phrases. The app is commonly used by students, teachers, and writers, with accuracy levels above 90%, depending on language and speaker. It requires no installation or registration, offering a simple and accessible tool for voice-to-text conversion.

youTubeVideos.title: Dictating to your Computer on speechtexter.com

name: Just Read
description: Just Read is a feature-packed and customizable reader view. View web articles in a more readable, attractive, and custom format.A feature-packed, customizable reader extension. With one click (or less!), you can remove distractions like: the page's styling, ads, pop-ups, or comments. Read the article in a customizable, simplified format - like a read mode but better!

youTubeVideos.title: Just Read reader extension

name: BeeLine Reader
description: BeeLine Reader is a research-backed tool that improves reading ability for students of all ages and skill levels. BeeLine's eye-guiding color gradients improve focus and can also reduce screen fatigue, which is especially important for students who are distance learning.

youTubeVideos.title: BeeLine Quick Start Video

name: Hemingway Editor
description: Hemingway Editor helps you write clearly and correctly. It shows common mistakes that make your writing harder to understand. It checks how easy your writing is to read and highlights the most difficult sentences. It also points out things that weaken your message.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Use Hemingway Editor for Self-Editing Your Writing

name: Morphic
description: Morphic is a tiny app that makes computers easier to use by 1. providing a toolbar that makes it easy to discover and use accessibility features built into computers and 2. allowing assistive technology (AT) users to use their AT on any computer that has Morphic installed.

youTubeVideos.title: Morphic Basic

name: Read Aloud
description: Read Aloud is a tool that lets you listen to the text on a webpage with just one click. It turns written text into speech using text-to-speech (TTS) technology and supports over 40 languages. You can use it on many websites, like news, blogs, school sites, online courses, and more. You can choose different voices to read the text, including ones built into your browser or text-to-speech cloud service providers. Some of these voices might cost extra. Read Aloud can also read PDF files, Google Docs, Google Play Books, Amazon Kindle books, and EPUB files (with the EPUBReader extension).

youTubeVideos.title: How to use the Read Aloud browser extension

name: Clicker
description: Clicker Writing Solution is an educational software suite designed to support literacy and writing skills development in students, particularly those with learning disabilities, language delays, or emerging literacy skills. Clicker offers tools that assist with writing, reading, and communication, making it ideal for use in both mainstream and special education settings. It is available for desktop (Windows and Mac) as well as tablets, providing flexibility across devices.

name: Voice Access
description: Voice access in Windows 11 helps people control their PC and produce text using their voice. For example, you can open and switch between apps, browse the web, and read and write emails using your voice. Voice access uses on-device speech recognition to recognize speech and works even without the internet.

youTubeVideos.title: Getting started with Voice Access | Windows 11

name: Proloquo2Go
description: Proloquo2Go is an augmentative and alternative communication app designed to help individuals with speech impairments communicate more effectively. It is widely used by people with conditions such as autism, cerebral palsy, Down syndrome, and other speech-related disabilities. The app provides a customizable, symbol-based communication system that allows users to build and speak sentences using images and text. It is a versatile tool that allows voice output, personalized vocabulary, and adaptability for different skill levels.

youTubeVideos.title: Getting started with Proloquo2Go

name: Bookshare Reader
description: Bookshare reader is a reading tool for individuals who have difficulty accessing traditional printed text. Users can access and read over a million books, including textbooks, novels, and other educational materials, in a variety of formats like audio, braille, and large print. The reader offers customizable features such as adjustable text size, font, and reading speed, along with options for high-quality text-to-speech.

youTubeVideos.title: How to read with Bookshare Reader for web browsers
Bookshare Reader for Educators Part 1

name: Lazarillo App
description: The Lazarillo App is a navigation and orientation tool designed specifically to assist individuals who are blind or have low vision. It provides real-time audio guidance, helping users navigate both indoor and outdoor environments independently. Named after the Spanish word for “guide,” Lazarillo aims to improve mobility and accessibility, enhancing the independence and confidence of its users.

name: Magnification Gesture
description: Magnification Gesture on Android is an accessibility feature that allows users with visual disabilities, zoom in on parts of the screen using simple touch gestures. This feature enhances the visibility of text, images, and other on-screen content, making it easier for users to interact with their devices.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use Magnification on Android & Everything You Need to Know! #accessibility

name: Live Text
description: Use your iPhone camera to copy, share, look up, and translate text that appears within the camera frame. Camera also provides quick actions to easily call phone numbers, visit websites, convert currencies, and more, based on the text that appears in the frame.

youTubeVideos.title: iOS 15 Live Text - How It Works on Your iPhone [Guide]

name: Display Zoom
description: With you choose "Larger Text" in display zoom, you can magnify and enlarge the entire iPhone screen. Everything you see on your phone, including all installed apps, is automatically enlarged. You can't make adjustments to it.

youTubeVideos.title: Get Easy iPhone Reading with BIGGER Text and Icons! Enable Display Zoom

name: ATbar
description: It is designed for those who may not have their assistive technologies at hand and need a quick way of accessing text on the screen with magnification and/or text to speech etc. It can help those with low vision, dyslexia and other reading difficulties, as well as those who may wish to just reduce the glare of black text on bright white backgrounds. It is not designed for regular screen reader users who need their assistive technology to access the computer as well as their browser.

youTubeVideos.title: Use of ATbar to increase the accessibility of an online content

name: Hover Text
description: Hover text lets you see a larger view of the item under the pointer when you hover over something. You can choose a short-key, and when you press the short key, the text under the pointer will be enlarged. You can adjust the size, color, background color, border color, and font of the text that is enlarged.

youTubeVideos.title: Use Hover Text To Make It Easier To Read and Type On a Mac

name: Pointer Control
description: With you choose "Larger Text" in display zoom, you can magnify and enlarge the entire iPhone screen. Everything you see on your phone, including all installed apps, is automatically enlarged. You can't make adjustions to it.

youTubeVideos.title: Controlling Your Mac With Head Movements

name: Goally
description: Focuses on improving executive functioning skills by providing visual schedules, reminders, and goal-setting features for children, particularly those with ADHD, autism, and other cognitive challenges

youTubeVideos.title: What are Visual Schedule Apps?

name: GoTalk NOW
description: Help individuals with speech and language challenges communicate more effectively through features like text-to-speech, customizable vocabulary, touchscreen interface, and portable design

youTubeVideos.title: Go Talk Now App

name: Messenger Pigeon
description: Messenger Pigeon is a learning tool that allows users to capture and organize educational content, such as audio and video recordings. It offers automated transcription, captioning, AI-generated summaries and quizzes, and the option to get notes from your recordings written by a professional. It also provides an AI assistant that generates summaries, keywords, and quizzes to help with comprehension and retention. Additional features such as speed control and grammar check are also included.

youTubeVideos.title: Study Smarter With The Messenger Pigeon Mobile App
Video title unavailable

name: Dasher
description: Dasher is designed to help people with physical difficulties and therefore this is where it is most accessible. It can be accessed using any pointing device but people are particularly excited about the use of eye tracking technologies. Although these systems are in their infancy a few are emerging that, coupled with Dasher, could provide severely disabled people with a method of producing text in a fast and comfortable manner. For those with decent head movement a head pointer could provide a cheaper, and more established, solution.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use Dasher with acessibility switches

name: SmartClick
description: SmartClick is designed to allow any user that can operate a pointing device (mouse, trackball, serial joystick, headmouse, single switch, etc), but cannot click the pointing device buttons, to have the computer do mouse button functions for them. SmartClick can perform actions such as double-clicks, right-clicks, drags, and keyboard options. It also has features such as Auto-Repeat (mouse clicks or up/down arrows), Close Window, and Escape key. As long as you can move the mouse cursor (whether by mouse, trackball, joystick, laser-eye tracker, or any other means), you can completely run & operate your Windows computer.

name: WordComplete
company: Innovation Management Group & RJ Cooper & Associates
description: WordComplete is a typing aid that predicts words as you type. It starts with a basic vocabulary and learns new words as you use it. A list of possible words appears as you type, with the most common ones at the top. You can also see the predicted word "inline" as you type, showing how it will look when complete. WordComplete adapts to your writing style over time and becomes more accurate the more you use it. You can even create custom dictionaries for specialized vocabulary.

name: The Magnifier
description: The Magnifier allows you to magnify up to 40x . It can operate as a Full Screen magnifier or Area magnifier and can be controlled from the keyboard or mouse.

youTubeVideos.title: The Magnifier

name: OnScreen
description: OnScreen with Word Complete replaces your physical keyboard with an onscreen version that controls Windows functions (including logon) and all Windows programs It also offers over 200 international onscreen keyboards, word prediction / word completion, show/hide keys, zoom over keys, color and key background inversion, text to speech, 11 user panels, user programmable macros, and complete control over all computer functions. It offers word prediction, many keyboard layouts, and accessibility features like text-to-speech.

name: OnScreen with CrossScanner
company: Innovation Management Group & RJ Cooper & Associates
description: OnScreen with CrossScanner is an onscreen keyboard designed for people who use a single switch to control their computer. This software allows them to type, move the mouse cursor, and click on screen elements using only their switch. It works by scanning the screen and highlighting different options, allowing the user to select what they want with their switch. This makes it possible for people with limited mobility to use a computer independently. It also includes word prediction and other features to make typing easier.

name: Joystick-To-Mouse
description: Joystick-To-Mouse allows you to use any joystick to point & click just like a mouse. You can move the cursor with the joystick and use the buttons for clicking, dragging, and other mouse actions. It's helpful for people who have difficulty using a traditional mouse, and it offers a lot of customization options. You can assign keyboard shortcuts to joystick buttons, adjust cursor speed and sensitivity, and even create macros to perform complex actions with a single button press. It works with a wide range of joysticks and game controllers.

name: TextExpander
description: TextExpander is a productivity tool that allows users to store and quickly insert frequently used text snippets. Users can create custom abbreviations or phrases and use them to expand the desired text with keystrokes, saving time and improving efficiency. By reducing the need for repetitive typing, TextExpander can help individuals with communicate more effectively and efficiently.

youTubeVideos.title: Introduction to TextExpander

name: Zoom
description: Zoom is a cloud-based video conferencing app that supports virtual meetings, webinars, and collaboration across devices. It offers features like closed captioning, screen reader compatibility, video spotlights for sign language interpreters, and keyboard navigation, making virtual meetings more accessible. The app also supports screen sharing and audio recording, allowing users to review meeting content at their own pace.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Use Zoom - Free Video Conferencing & Virtual Meetings

name: Speech Blubs
description: Speech Blubs is a speech therapy app that helps children with speech delays and communication challenges. It includes interactive games and fun videos to encourage speech practice and improve pronunciation. The app includes voice-controlled activities, providing instant feedback to enhance learning and offers progress tracking for parents and therapists to monitor improvements.

youTubeVideos.title: Speech Blubs: The Best Speech Therapy App

name: Language Therapy 4-in-1
description: The language Therapy app supports individuals with language disorders, including aphasia, stroke and traumatic brain injury. The app provides therapy exercises to improve language skills focusing on four key areas: Naming, Sentence Building, Auditory Comprehension, and Reading Comprehension.

youTubeVideos.title: Language Therapy 4-in-1 Aphasia App Preview

name: Visual Attention Therapy (lite & full version)
description: Visual Attention Therapy is a cognitive rehabilitation app that helps individuals improve their visual attention skills, particularly those resulting from brain injuries, strokes, or neurological conditions, by focusing on improving the ability to notice, process, and respond to visual stimuli. The exercises target different aspects of visual attention and allows users to customize difficulty levels based on their individual needs.

youTubeVideos.title: Visual Attention Therapy by Tactus Therapy

name: RoboBraille
description: RoboBraille is a service designed to enhance accessibility for individuals with vision or reading difficulties. It allows users to convert text documents into various accessible formats, such as Braille, audio, or large print, facilitating easier access to written content.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Create an Accessible PDF using RoboBraille in Moodle

name: Touch Accommodations
description: Touch Accommodations is a feature allowing users to change how the screen on their device responds to taps, swipes, and other gestures. The four main features that users can adjust includes hold duration, swipe gestures, ignore repeat, tap assistance, and tap assistance delay.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use Touch Accommodations on your iPhone or iPad | Apple Support

name: Dyslexia Font Keyboard and Pal
description: DyslexiaKey makes typing less frustrating for those with dyslexia. By using a specific font created specifically for dyslexic individuals, this app allows people affected by dyslexia to type with ease as well as use AI to learn new information, understand abstract ideas and come up with new recipes with left over ingredients.

name: Speakprose 3
description: SpeakProse 3 from Cognixion is a text-to-speech software that allows you to convert written text into spoken words, has the ability to assemble sentences naturally, it also acts as a keyboard. It uses eye-tracking, face and gaze tracking and the ability to personalize your own short phrases to quickly select and send them. Amazon's alexa is also built inside, the user can order groceries and control their home lights if they have alexa.

youTubeVideos.title: Cognixion Speakprose Pro+ live demonstration

name: Guided Access
description: Guided Access helps you stay focused on the task (or app) at hand. You can limit a device to stay on one app at a time by deactivating the Home button on iPhone and iPad — or gesture on iPhone, iPad, and Apple Vision Pro. You can even restrict access to the keyboard — or touch input on certain areas of the screen on iPhone or iPad — so wandering taps and gestures won’t distract from learning.

youTubeVideos.title: How to limit your iPhone to one app with Guided Access | Apple Support

name: Assistive Access
description: Assistive Access makes it easy for people with cognitive disabilities to tailor iPhone and iPad to lighten cognitive load and suit their specific needs and preferences. Designed with feedback from individuals with cognitive disabilities and their trusted supporters, Assistive Access offers a distinctive interface with high-contrast buttons, large text labels, and visual alternatives to text. It also has tools to help individuals and their trusted supporters adjust the experience in specific apps.

youTubeVideos.title: Video title unavailable

name: Real Writer and Reader
description: Ghotit Real Writer and Reader provides support to individuals who struggle with reading, writing, dyslexia, and other writing problems. It assists users in writing clearly and precisely as well as offering phonetic spell checking, context-aware text prediction, and sophisticated grammar and spelling correction.

youTubeVideos.title: Ghotit Real Writer & Reader

name: ScripTalk
description: ScripTalk Talking Prescription Labels are based on RFID text-to-speech technology and are intended to assist in providing better care for patients who are blind or have trouble reading print. The patients can hear all of their important prescription information read aloud by this smartphone app. This information includes the name of drug, its dosage, and directions, any cautionary notes and restrictions, pharmacy data, name of the doctor and the date and prescription number.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Use the ScripTalk Mobile App

name: Color Blind Pal
description: Color Blind Pal helps people who are color blind see colors around them. It can also provide a look into the world of color blindness for those with regular eyesight. You just have to launch the app, then aim you phone camera at the image you wish to see. You can also use the color filter to make the colors on a color-coded map easier to see if you're having trouble reading it.

youTubeVideos.title: Color Blind Pal demo

name: LetMeTalk
description: LetMeTalk is supported by donationsallows you to read a row of photos as a sentence by arranging the images in a meaningful way. You can also use the built-in camera to take new pictures or upload the and since LetMeTalk doesn't require an internet connection you can use it practically anywhere, even in nursing homes, schools, and hospitals.

youTubeVideos.title: Free AAC: Let Me Talk Tutorial

name: Cboard ACC
description: Cboard is an open-source app to assist with speech and language, aiding communication with symbols and text-to-speech.

youTubeVideos.title: Introduction to Cboard

name: e-Mintza
description: E-Mintza is a customizable and dynamic system of augmentative and alternative communication aimed at people with autism or with barriers of oral or written communication.

youTubeVideos.title: E mintza!!!!!

name: Alexicom AAC
description: Alexicom AAC enables Android or iOS devices to serve as augmentative communication devices. Users can publish Alexicom augmentative communication pages to their devices. Communication pages with text, images, and AT&T Natural Voices speech output can be downloaded directly from the Alexicom server or imported from a PC or Mac using iTunes.

youTubeVideos.title: Alexicom Tech

name: Camera Mouse
description: Camera Mouse is a free program that allows you to control the mouse pointer on a Windows computer just by moving your head. Clicking can be done by making the mouse pointer dwell over a spot on the screen (after first turning Clicking on in Settings)

youTubeVideos.title: Camera Mouse Video

name: Banner style
description: For some users, push notifications on mobile devices do not remain on the screen long enough to read them fully by default. Here users can modify how long a notification appears.

youTubeVideos.title: iPhone 13/13 Pro: How to Set Phone Notifications Banner Style to Temporary or Consistent

name: Aira Explorer App
description: Aira provides on-demand, remote visual interpreting for the blind and low vision community. People can download Aira, and with a tap their phone camera will stream a live video to one of Aira’s professional Visual Interpreters who can assist by explaining callers’ surroundings, describing, narrating, navigating, or reading.

youTubeVideos.title: Meet Aira

name: Audio Description
description: Audio Description provides the visual information that is needed to understand the content of a video.It involves the narration of key visual elements, such as actions, settings, facial expressions, and other relevant details, to provide a comprehensive audio representation of what is happening on the screen.

youTubeVideos.title: What is Audio Description, and why is it necessary? (audio-described version)

name: Oko
description: OKO app is an assistive technology designed to support people with visual impairments to help them safely navigate intersections. The app helps blind or visually impaired individuals know when it’s safe to cross the street by notifying them of the pedestrian light status.

youTubeVideos.title: CSUN ATC 2023: AYES OKO Navigation Aid for Blind & Low Vision

name: Talking Clipboard
description: Talking Clipboard is a text-to-speech app for compatible Android devices. It can read ePub Books, text, or HTML files (by converting webpage articles to text). It can also read text copied from any application using a read clipboard feature available through the notification/status bar. Talking Clipboard requires the installation of OI File Manager from the Android market.

youTubeVideos.title: Talking Clipboard RSS Reading

name: WordWeb Pro Audio Dictionary
description: WordWeb Pro is an audio dictionary that can look up words in virtually any program with just one click. There are many features, including adding definitions to the database and importing and exporting custom definitions and glossaries. If users are online, they can also search web references. WordWeb has the option to highlight widely used synonyms and replace a word which is great for helping to write easy-to-understand English.

youTubeVideos.title: Wordweb (Free dictionary with Audio pronunciations) 2019 |Wordweb |How to Use

name: Moon+ Reader Pro
description: Moon+ Reader Pro is an Android app with powerful controls and functions for users who have difficulties with handling and reading physical books. It offers many features such as five auto-scroll modes, multi-point touch support, and customized operations like screen click. Additionally, Moon+ Reader Pro supports epub, pdf, mobi, chm, and more formats, along with multiple online book sites.

youTubeVideos.title: Best Ebook Reader On Android | Moon Reader Features Review

name: Fire Vox
description: Fire Vox is an open-source, freely available talking browser extension for the Firefox web browser. It is a screen reader designed to accommodate different users with different needs. Additionally, all Fire Vox commands are keyboard activated and its highlighting feature makes it easy to keep track of where it is reading from on a page.

name: Accessible Podcatcher
description: Accessible Podcatcher is a free program that enables blind and screen reader users to listen to podcasts. Users can listen to podcasts, fast forward and rewind them, save particular items to disk, and export and import lists of podcasts to send to other people. Compared to podcasting, podcatching is the process of receiving and listening to other people's podcasts

name: The Open Voice Factory
description: The Open Voice Factory is free speech aid software that converts communication boards into communication devices. It lets users, family, and carers create pages of speech in PowerPoint and parses them into functioning speech aids.

youTubeVideos.title: The Open Voice Factory - Getting Started on Windows

name: MAGic
description: MAGic is a software program designed for low-vision computer users. It combines screen magnification and screen reading features to help users work more efficiently with various applications, such as business tools, documents, email, web browsing, and social media.

youTubeVideos.title: MAGic Screen Magnification Software - Now in HD

name: The vOICe
description: The vOICe provides a way to enhance reality and visual information using technology that helps people see their surroundings differently. It includes two main features: a talking color identifier that announces the color of whatever is in the center of the camera’s view, and a talking compass that lets users know which direction they’re facing.

youTubeVideos.title: Grasping objects with The vOICe (sensory substitution for the blind)

name: Flip Writer AAC
description: Flip Writer AAC is an app that delivers tools for adults and children relating to speech. Users can type a message on Flip Writer, and this message is displayed on two displays, one facing them and a second outfacing display for their communication partner(s). It also has built-in speech recognition that allows communication partners to speak into the app and have their speech converted to large and legible text that can be easily read.

youTubeVideos.title: 032316 FlipWriter

name: GalaPro
description: GalaPro is a mobile application designed to help individuals with hearing loss access free real-time closed captioning of live performing arts shows, other entertainment or conference venues. It also offers an amplified rendering of the dialogue.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use the GalaPro app

name: Pratsam Reader
description: Pratsam Reader is an app that alllows users to listen to digital talking books and talking newspapers. Users can play content from accessible books service provider or play content from the internal memory of a device. The app supports streaming or download accessible books to the app, if the users service provider allows it. Users can also add publications to the app with a computer. You can select books from a bookshelf, navigate in the content by chapters, sections and page numbers, manage bookmarks, use a sleep timer, or change the playback speed.

name: AppWriter
description: AppWriter is an assistive technology tool for reading and writing. It includes text to speech as well as word prediction.

youTubeVideos.title: AppWriter Workshop (gratis)

name: Reduce White Point
description: Reduce White Point limits the brightness of colors on the display of an iOS device for a person with certain types of vision limitations. The lower contrast of colors can assist those who experience glare as a barrier.

youTubeVideos.title: How To Reduce White Point On iPhone

name: Brighter and Bigger App
description: Brighter and Bigger is a "reading glasses" app for iOS and Android, designed for those who have difficulty reading fine print and focusing on nearby objects. This app helps individuals with sight issues read small letters by making the images bigger, brighter and clearer with scientific color changing methods.

name: RemoteKeys
description:
RemoteKeys lets the user assign functions to different keystrokes. For example, inserting a text passage into a document or filling out forms with reoccuring phrases. RemoteKeys will automate complex control systems, but also simple jobs like inserting text passages into Word and EMails, filling out (internet-) forms with recurring phrases etc.

To do this simply click onto one of the 2500 buttons, which can be freely assigned and labeled. The macros can also be released by using the keyboard if preferred.

For those wishing to make full use of RemoteKeys, there are over 400 commands available, e.g. inserting the actual date into a text, opening program groups and ordering them on screen or even to automate Excel calculations.

The buttons may be assigned with the help of the integrated macro recorder and an integrated timer can activate these buttons. Additional features include an image memory and a clipboard history function.

RemoteKeys is always at hand in the system tray, can be individually configured (button-, form-, font sizes and colors), is network-able, offers database access and requires no installation. (Engl./Ger./French with manual).

name: Point-N-Click
description: Point-N-Click is an on-screen virtual mouse designed for anyone with a disability that makes it difficult or impossible to click a physical computer mouse. As long as the mouse, trackball or another pointing device can be moved, mouse clicks can be sent to virtually any Windows application or DOS application that can run within a window and even many that are full screen.

name: Aipoly Vision
description: Aipoly Vision is an object and color recognizer app that helps people with vision loss and color blindness. After pointing the phone at the object of interest and pressing any of the recognition buttons at the bottom of the screen to turn on the artificial intelligence, Aipoly will speak out loud what it sees. Additionally, its main features are that the app can recognize a wide variety of objects at a rate of three times a second through the camera and it can read a text in multiple languages.

youTubeVideos.title: Aipoly Vision App

name: beKEY
description:
beKey is an on screen keyboard. It is customizable in size and spacing of keys, has word prediction, only uses a single click or hover mode, and a deluxe version for special keys and scanning mode. beKey also supports inputs, such as headmouse, eye control, and joystick. intelligent word prediction, already trained using more than 1000 letters, emails and speeches
..and it keeps learning as you type
	 	our word prediction will not only offer suggestions to complete the word you're currently typing,
but also for the complete next word!
	 	Word prediction dictionaries in 23 languages available
	 	many options to configure according to your needs:
Total size, size of key caps, distance between key caps, font size etc. can be easily adjusted
	 	optimized to be used with one click only (no double clicks, no drag and drop)
	 	supports click mode and dwell ("hover") mode
	 	"Skin" mode for customized looks with graphics (all versions)
	 	Transparent display
	 	Special keys for frequently used tasks (deluxe versions only)
	 	Scanning modes for 1 or 2 switches (deluxe SCAN version only)

name: Head Pilot
description: Head Pilot is a contactless Head Tracking assistive technology for people who cannot use a traditional keyboard or mouse.The user controls the cursor and generates a time-delayed click using their webcam and head movements alone.

youTubeVideos.title: Head Pilot, Nouvelle version
Head Pilot Online : présentation générale

name: SuperVision+ Magnifier
description: SuperVision+ Magnifier helps users read small prints at near distances and signs at far distances. This tool also has an image stabilization feature.

youTubeVideos.title: Using SuperVision magnifier, Android

name: Big Keys Keyboard
description: Big Keys Keyboard is an apple app that allows the user to resize the mobile device's keyboard and emoji sizes so that they can easily be seen.

name: ColoredEye
description: ColoredEye is an app that will identify the colors from the camera in real-time or identify colors within a saved photo.

name: Over 40
description: Over 40 Magnifier and Flashlight is a video magnification app. It also has features that accomdate both right and left handed users.

youTubeVideos.title: iPhone Flashlight & Magnification App ~ Free Apps For iPhone

name: Ease Touch
description: Ease Touch is an Android app that enables users to control their devices with a single finger. It captures all touches on the screen, distinguishes voluntary touches from non-voluntary ones, and allows users to perform most standard gestures, such as tap, double-tap, drag, swipe, and pinch. Users can also navigate back or home, open notifications, view running apps, zoom in/out, and scroll content easily.

youTubeVideos.title: 1. Ease Touch. Introduction

name: Color Filters
description: The iOS Color Filters modify the colors on the display to help a person with color blindness differentiate between the colors that they have difficulty seeing. It includes four color blindness filter patterns, a color tint option with hue control, and an intensity setting to adjust how much the colors are shifted.

youTubeVideos.title: Video title unavailable

name: Assistive Touch
description: AssistiveTouch is an iOS feature that you can use with a stylus to control your device, help you perform gestures like a pinch, multi-finger swipe, or 3D Touch, and use Siri. AssistiveTouch allows you to adjust certain settings on your device, including volume, rotate screen, lock screen, and more.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use AssistiveTouch on your iPhone or iPad — Apple Support

name: Z5/P3
description: Z5/P3 is a VRS app for deaf and hard-of-hearing individuals, allowing them to make VP calls using Wi-Fi or cellular data. It includes text chat, the ability to share a follow-up number with an interpreter, and the power to block unwanted callers.

youTubeVideos.title: P3 Mobile is here for you!

name: Verba Voice
description: The VerbaVoice Webplayer app lets people with hearing difficulties join events by streaming live text and sign language. The spoken content is sent to a sign language interpreter or speech-to-text reporter, who then turns it into text and sign language in real time.

name: CViConnect
description: CVIConnect is a specialized digital tool designed for individuals with Cortical Visual Impairment (CVI). It helps adapt visual materials by adjusting contrast, complexity, and movement to match each person's CVI needs. The platform allows tracking of visual progress, creates custom learning materials, and connects parents and teachers to coordinate care. It also includes a resource library with CVI-specific guides and materials, making it a comprehensive support system for managing CVI care and education.

youTubeVideos.title: Introduction to CVi Connect

name: Duxbury DBT
description: The Duxbury Braille Translator (DBT) is a specialized software that converts regular text into braille code. The software can translate multiple languages and handle complex content like mathematics and music into accurate braille format, while maintaining proper document formatting. DBT makes it possible to quickly convert regular documents, books, and educational materials into braille, making written content accessible to blind and low-vision readers.

youTubeVideos.title: Duxbury DBT 12.5 Braille Software Installation: DBT the world's most popular braille editor software

name: Greta
description: Greta is an app that helps people with sight or hearing loss enjoy movies. It provides foreign language subtitles and audio versions for an international audience, and plays audio descriptions, subtitles/closed captions, sound amplification, and sign language videos for hard-of-hearing individuals and people with hearing loss using a smartphone or tablet.

youTubeVideos.title: Greta: Just enjoy Cinema

name: Shouter Pro - The Announcer
description: An app that announces caller names while the phone is ringing and announces missed calls. It also reads text messages. The main features include notification reading (for Jellybean 4.3 and above), time announcement at user-defined intervals, battery status announcement, device charging state announcement, and voice reminders.

youTubeVideos.title: Android app - Shouter

name: Emvi
description: EMVI (Envision Mobile Visual Intelligence) is a visual assistant designed specifically for blind and visually impaired people. It helps them better navigate and interact with their surroundings.

youTubeVideos.title: Video title unavailable

name: PiCom Communicator for AAC
description: PiCom is an application designed for Augmentative and Alternative Communication (AAC). It enables users to communicate using picture symbols, with options for text-to-speech or recorded voice output. This app is intended to assist individuals who have difficulty speaking and for whom symbol-based communication is considered appropriate.

youTubeVideos.title: PiCom AAC app on Windows Surface

name: GoodMaps
description: GoodMaps is an accessible navigation app designed to assist blind or low-vision users in navigating indoor and outdoor environments.

youTubeVideos.title: GoodMaps – Brand Film

name: ReBokeh
description: The ReBokeh App is a tool designed for people with low vision. It uses the camera on an iOS device to enhance what the user sees by allowing them to adjust various visual settings. These adjustments include changing contrast, brightness, and colors, applying inversion filters, and using zoom to make objects and text larger.

youTubeVideos.title: How an app is helping low vision people navigate life better - BBC News

name: Eye Tracking
description: Powered by artificial intelligence, Eye Tracking gives users a built-in option for navigating iPad and iPhone with just their eyes. Designed for users with physical disabilities, Eye Tracking uses the front-facing camera to set up and calibrate in seconds, and with on-device machine learning, all data used to set up and control this feature is kept securely on device, and isn’t shared with Apple.

youTubeVideos.title: How To Use Eye Tracking on iOS 18

name: Music Haptics
description: Music Haptics is a new way for users who are deaf or hard of hearing to experience music on iPhone. With this accessibility feature turned on, the Taptic Engine in iPhone plays taps, textures, and refined vibrations to the audio of the music. Music Haptics works across millions of songs in the Apple Music catalog, and will be available as an API for developers to make music more accessible in their apps.

youTubeVideos.title: iOS 18 - Enable Music Haptics on iPhone

name: Vocal Shortcuts
description: With Vocal Shortcuts, iPhone and iPad users can assign custom utterances that Siri can understand to launch shortcuts and complete complex tasks. Listen for Atypical Speech, another new feature, gives users an option for enhancing speech recognition for a wider range of speech. Listen for Atypical Speech uses on-device machine learning to recognize user speech patterns. Designed for users with acquired or progressive conditions that affect speech, such as cerebral palsy, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), or stroke, these features provide a new level of customization and control.

youTubeVideos.title: Using Vocal Shortcuts On Mac and iPhone
Best New macOS Sequoia Feature - Vocal Shortcuts - Control Mac With Your Voice

name: Voice Control
description: Once you’ve downloaded Voice Control, you can use your voice on your iPhone to perform daily tasks even without an internet connection. Simply speak commands as you would tap the screen. For more precise control, say “Show grid” to display a numbered overlay. By saying a number from the grid, you can zoom in on that specific section, revealing a new set of numbers to help you select what you want.Voice Control isn't available in all countries or regions. Voice Control uses the Siri speech recognition engine for U.S. English only.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use Voice Control on iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch | Apple Support

name: Voice Isolation
description: With voice isolation you can tweak the microphone settings to cut out background noise for a clearer voice, leave the background sounds on if you want both your voice and what's happening around you to be picked up, or let it automatically switch to the best mode for your situation.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Add Voice Isolation on iPhone on iOS 18

name: LED Flash for Alerts
description: The LED flash beside the camera lens on the back of your iPhone or iPad can blink when your device is locked and you receive a notification. This feature can be helpful for anyone who might miss audible alerts.

youTubeVideos.title: iPhone: How to Turn On Flashing LED Light Notification Accessibility Feature on Your iPhone

name: Head Eye Communication
description: Produces short commuication sentences vocalized by SAPI5 speech synthesis. Letters in Groups are shown on the screen from which the start of the word is chosen. The groups are to be determined according to the needs of the user: one can choose an alphabetical EJARIN arrangement, or other.

name: Haptic Touch
description: You can adjust the length of time when you press on the display. For instance, you can change the touch duration to fast, default, or slow your touch takes to reveal content previews actions, and contextual menus.

youTubeVideos.title: Make Haptic Touch FASTER with this Setting! 📱 #shorts #iphone #haptictouch #3dtouch

name: Back Tap
description: You can double-tap or triple-tap the back of iPhone to perform actions more quickly. You can set your own double tap or triple tap shortcuts, such as taking a screenshot, turning on an accessibility feature, running a shortcut, and more.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use Back Tap on iPhone | Apple Support

name: Reachability
description: When you use iPhone with one hand in portrait orientation, you can use Reachability to lower the top half of the screen so it’s within easy reach of your thumb.

youTubeVideos.title: How to reach the top of your iPhone screen with one hand | Apple Support

name: Reduce Transparency
description: Some interface elements, such as the Dock and menu bar, appear transparent by default. You can turn these transparent elements opaque by giving them a solid color. In this way you simplify those parts of your screen and make them easier to see.

youTubeVideos.title: How To Reduce Transparency On iPhone

name: Larger Accessibility Sizes
description: Allows apps that support Dynamic Type to adjust text to shown in preferred reading size.

youTubeVideos.title: See Better with Larger Accessibility Sizes

name: Increased Contrast
description: Increased color contrast between app foreground and background colors.

youTubeVideos.title: How To Increase Contrast On iPhone

name: Differentiate Without Color
description: Replaces user interface items that rely solely on color to convey information with alternatives.

youTubeVideos.title: How To Differentiate Without Color On iPhone

name: Smart Invert
description: Smart Invert reverses the color of the display, except for images, media and some apps that use dark color styles.

youTubeVideos.title: How To Turn On Or Off Smart Invert In iPhone

name: Prefer Horizontal Text
description: Prefer text to be shown horizontally for languages that support vertical text.

youTubeVideos.title: iPhone 15/15 Pro Max: How to Enable/Disable Prefer Horizontal Text

name: Classic Invert
description: Classic Invert reverses the colors of all content on the display.

youTubeVideos.title: iPhone 14's/14 Pro Max: How to Turn On/Off Classic Invert

name: Auto-Brightness
description: The Auto-Brightness feature on Apple devices automatically adjusts the screen brightness based on the surrounding lighting conditions. This feature uses the ambient light sensor built into the device to detect the level of light in your environment, then dims or brightens the screen accordingly. Auto-Brightness helps improve visibility in different lighting situations, reduces eye strain, and conserves battery life by optimizing screen brightness.

youTubeVideos.title: How To Turn Off / On Automatic Brightness On iPhone 13

name: Reduce Motion
description: Your device uses motion effects to create the perception of depth on your Home screen and within apps. If you have sensitivity to motion effects or screen movement on your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch, you can use Reduce Motion to turn off these effects.

youTubeVideos.title: How To Reduce Motion On iPhone

name: Dim Flash Lights
description: The Dim Flashing Lights feature in iOS is an accessibility option that reduces the intensity of flashing or strobe effects on screen, aiming to make the device more comfortable for individuals sensitive to flashing lights, such as those with epilepsy or sensory sensitivities.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Turn On Dim Flashing Lights on iPhone

name: Prefer Non-Blinking Cursor
description: Set the cursor indicator in text to be non-blinking across the system.

name: Hold Duration
description: If you have difficulties with hand tremors, dexterity, or fine motor control, you can adjust how the iPhone touchscreen responds to tap, swipe, and touch-and-hold gestures. You can have iPhone recognize faster or slower touches and ignore multiple touches. You can also prevent iPhone from waking when you touch the screen, or turn off Shake to Undo if you unintentionally shake iPhone.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use Touch Accommodations on your iPhone or iPad | Apple Support

name: Ignore Repeat
description: If you have difficulties with hand tremors, dexterity, or fine motor control, you can adjust how the iPhone touchscreen responds to tap, swipe, and touch-and-hold gestures. You can have iPhone recognize faster or slower touches and ignore multiple touches. You can also prevent iPhone from waking when you touch the screen, or turn off Shake to Undo if you unintentionally shake iPhone.

name: Tap Assistance
description: The Apple "Tap Assistance" feature is an accessibility tool in iOS that helps users who may struggle with precise or consistent tapping. It is part of the broader Touch Accommodations settings, which can be accessed in Settings > Accessibility > Touch > Touch Accommodations on an iPhone.

youTubeVideos.title: HOW TO ENABLE TAP ASSISTANCE ON IPHONE

name: Control Nearby Devices
description: Apple's Control Nearby Devices feature allows users to control and interact with nearby Apple devices, such as an iPhone, iPad, or Mac, using another device.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Get to Control Nearby Devices on iPhone and What it does?

name: Full Keyboard Access
description: Apple's Full Keyboard Access feature allows users to navigate their Mac or iPhone using a keyboard instead of a mouse or trackpad

youTubeVideos.title: iPhone 14's/14 Pro Max: How to Enable/Disable Full Keyboard Access For External Keyboard

name: Live Recognition
description: Apple's Live Recognition feature provides live descriptions of the surroundings using VoiceOver on an iPhone.

youTubeVideos.title: iOS 18 NEW Live Recognition

name: Speak Screen
description: Apple's Speak Screen feature allows your iPhone or iPad to read text on the screen, selected text, or typing feedback.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use Speak Screen on iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch — Apple Support

name: Left/Right Balance
description: The left/right balance feature on Apple devices adjusts the volume of the left and right speakers, headphones, or hearing aids.

youTubeVideos.title: iPhone 13/13 Pro: How to Change Headphone Left and Right Transparency Balance

name: Speak Selection
description: Allows to speak the text you select. The speak selection features allows for the selected text to be read.

youTubeVideos.title: How to have your iPhone or iPad read text to you | Apple Support

name: RTT/TTY
description: RTT/TTY allows individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing to use text to communicate in real-time during phone calls. This feature works by sending text immediately as it is typed, without needing to press 'Send'. This can be particularly useful for conveying nuances such as laughter, interruption, or pauses in conversation.

youTubeVideos.title: How To Use RTT

name: Mono Audio
description: Mono Audio consolidates the sound channels into one channel, ensuring that all sounds are heard in both ears, which is especially useful for users with hearing loss in one ear. This feature helps to ensure that no part of the audio is lost or diminished, enhancing the audio experience for those who require it.

youTubeVideos.title: iPhone 13/Pro: How to Enable/Disable Mono Audio To Make Left & Right Speakers Play the Same Content

name: Attention Awareness
description: Attention Awareness reduces the volume of alerts and dims the display when you are not looking at your iPhone. This feature uses the TrueDepth camera to detect your attention and adjust settings accordingly, helping to conserve battery life and reduce distractions when you are not actively engaging with your device.

youTubeVideos.title: iOS 17: How to Turn Off Attention Aware on iPhone

name: Scanning Style
description: Scanning style allows users to chose how the cursor moves between items on the screen. The options are Auto Scanning which automatically moves to the next item after a set amount of time. If the user uses this setting with one switch then you must assign the select item action to the switch. Manual Scanning that requires at least two switches, with one switch being assigned to move to the next item action and the other assigned to the select item action. Lastly single switch step scanning that requires one switch, with the move to the next item action assigned to the switch. If no action is taken within the set amount of time, the current item is automatically selected.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Use Switch Control on iPhone

name: Accessories AirPods
description: When paired with AirPods, you can adjust built-in accessibility features on your AirPods. You can adjust the press speed of your  AirPod's buttons, adjust the press and hold duration to smake them shorter, or turn on noise control with only one AirPod in your ear. You can also turn off spatial audio head tracking.

youTubeVideos.title: How To Adjust AirPod Click Speed

name: Side Button
description: Side Button setting allows users to customize what the side button controls, including click speed customization (default, slow, slowest), Press and hold to speak (Siri, Classic Voice Control, Off) and Side Button Confirmation (enable confirm with switch control and enable confirm with AssistiveTouch).

name: Headphone Notifications
description: This setting protects your hearing, iPhone sends a notification if you've been listening to loud headphone audio for long enough to affect your hearing.

youTubeVideos.title: How To Turn Off Headphone Safety Notifications

name: Accessibility Shortcut
description: Users are able to configure and then triple click the side button to toggle features on or off.

youTubeVideos.title: Video title unavailable

name: Personal Voice
description: With Personal Voice, you can create a synthesized voice that sounds like your own to communicate with family and friends. You can use your Personal Voice to type to speak in FaceTime and phone calls, assistive communication apps, and in-person conversations.

youTubeVideos.title: Video title unavailable

name: Hearing Aid Compatibility
description: Hearing aid compatibility can enhance audio quality and reduce interference for certain models. It is important to note that compatibility ratings do not guarantee that a specific hearing aid will function optimally with a particular phone. In some cases, hearing aids may perform effectively even with phones that do not meet FCC compatibility standards. To ensure a successful pairing, it is recommended to test the devices together before making a purchase.

youTubeVideos.title: iPhone 13/13 Pro: How to Enable/Disable Hearing Aid Compatibility

name: Sound Recognition
description: Using Sound Recognition, iPhone can be set up to continuously listen for certain sounds — such as a doorbell, siren, or crying baby — and notify you when it recognizes these sounds.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use Sound Recognition on your iPhone or iPad — Apple Support

name: Background Sounds
description: Background Sounds plays ambient soundscapes in the background with your iPhone, iPad, or Mac. You can choose different background sounds from ocean, rain, bright noise sounds, and more.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use background sounds on your Mac | Apple Support

name: Per App Settings
description: Per App settings help you customize accessibility settings for each app so they can be flexibly helpful when you need them. For instance, if you want to adjust display and text size on your "Messages" app, you can add "Messages", and customize the accessibility features for it and only affect this app but not others. Depending on what the app supports, the adjustable settings will be different. In general, you can adjust many visual accessibility features, such as text display, contrast, dark mode, or more.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Use Per App Settings in Accessibility

name: Headphone Accomodations
description: Headphone Accomodations allows users of supported Apple and Beats headphone to optimize tone that boosts certain frequencies ranges, adjust the boost for soft sounds, and choose which media these settings will apply to.

youTubeVideos.title: iPhone 13/13 Pro: How to Enable/Disable Headphone Accommodation for Phone and Media Only

name: Stereo Audio Balance
description: Stereo Audio Balance allows users to adjust the audio volume balance between left and right channels.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Adjust Sound Balance on iPhone! [Left and Right]

name: Hover Typing
description: Enabling Hover Typing displays a larger, editable version of text as you type it. This feature also allows users to customize its Text size and Text font, Text-entry location, and Colors.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Use Hover Typing for Clearer Text Input in iOS 18

name: Typing Feedback
description: Typing Feedback provides additional feedback as you type as well as speak text corrections and word suggestions out loud.

youTubeVideos.title: How to have your iPhone and iPad speak each word as you type — Apple Support

name: Cephable Personal
description:
Cephable Personal is private, accessible, and productive AI software that empowers anyone to take control of their digital experiences. With adaptive voice & dictation controls, facial expressions, head movements, and custom quick action buttons, Cephable offers out-of-the-box adaptability, all without extra hardware. It works seamlessly with hundreds of apps and programs you already use on your PC or Mac. 

-Use dictation to write in social media 

-Open, close, or minimize your apps with your voice  

-Use head movements to control characters in games 

Cephable Personal is for individuals to use in their personal lives. Not for use on work issued devices or professional settings.

name: Cephable Plus
description:
Built accessible from the start, Cephable Plus helps individuals optimize how they work and interact with technology without compromising privacy. Our AI-powered software offers advanced voice and dictation controls, head movements, and custom quick action buttons to automate tasks. Cephable offers out-of-the-box adaptability, and no need for extra hardware. It works seamlessly with hundreds of apps and programs you already use on your PC or Mac. 

-Use dictation to write an email, and your voice to send it 

-Open, close, or minimize apps with a quick voice command 

-Mute a video call by simply turning your head 

-Contextual controls are prebuilt for your favorite tools 

Cephable Plus is made for individuals who want more power than Cephable Personal. It adds enhanced productivity tools and automation features to streamline workflows across the applications you rely on every day—personally and professionally.

name: Cephable Professional
description:
Cephable Professional is the secure, on-device, AI agent that works with all your apps and workflows. Cephable runs locally executing commands, generating content, and automating workflows across the tools you already use. Ready out-of-the-box. No cloud processing. Just private productivity that moves with you. 

-Boost productivity without compromising privacy 

-Run voice, tap, type, or gesture commands in any app 

-Generate, rewrite, summarize, and translate content—anywhere 

-Launch complex, multi-step workflows with a single command 

-Compatible with your favorite software—no training required 

-Built-in accessibility, scalable for teams and IT

Cephable Professional optimizes workflows in the workplace or for students in post-secondary education.

name: Cephable Educational
description:
Cephable Education is private, accessible, and productive AI software that empowers K-12 students to take control of their digital experiences. With advanced voice & dictation controls, head movements, and custom quick action buttons, Cephable offers out-of-the-box adaptability, all without extra hardware. It works seamlessly with hundreds of apps and programs students already use on your PC or Mac.  

-Use voice controls to navigate EdTech classroom apps  

-Head movements turn into mouse movements  

-Students with limited speech can use the sounds & words they can produce 

Cephable Education is for students in K-12 settings to boost their engagement and level the playing field for digital access for both general & special education.
